alert.note: Alert for Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 3:38PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact areas near the I-40 between Two Guns and Winslow through 430 PM MST... At 336 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Meteor Crater, or 11 miles west of Winslow, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Winslow and Meteor Crater. This includes the following highways... Business Interstate 40 between mile markers 252 and 253. Interstate 40 between mile markers 235 and 254. State Route 99 between mile markers 53 and 61. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County
